title: Tyro tips $240m revenue, more than 36,000 merchants
text:
Initial public offering-hopeful Tyro Payments reckons it can record 27 per cent revenue growth in its first financial year as a listed company.

The payments company has told its existing shareholders to expect $240 million revenue in the 12-months to June 30 next year, which would be up from $189.8 million last financial year and in line with 29 per cent average annual growth since 2014.

Tyro also told investors its merchant numbers were likely to increase 20 per cent to more than 36,000 in the financial year, while transaction value through its network was expected to be up 29 per cent to $22.5 billion.

Gross profit was likely to be about $100 million, compared to $83.3 million in the 2019 financial year.
description: IPO-hopeful Tyro Payments reckons it can record 27pc revenue growth in its first financial year as a listed company.
